channel.title: Best Low Profile Card
channel.description:
My dad has a dell XPS 200 and it currently has a 128MB Radeon X600
This thing sucks so bad it makes me want to cry every time I use it.
What I need is something fast for this but there is not alot of options for low-profile ready cards.
Can you guys tell me what the best pick for a low-profile ready card on newegg is because im having a hard time choosing.
http://www.newegg.com/Product/ProductList.aspx?Submit=ENE&N=2010380048%201419531894&ShowDeactivatedMark=False[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 26, 2009, 08:54:01 pm[/size][hr]I was thinking this one but the fan on the top will hit the top of the harddrive because the card sits upside down....like on all freaking dell computers.
http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814187061

item.title: Best Low Profile Card
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“mwiebelhaus, post:18, topic:304621”]Question, I just bought memory for his current motherboard (4GB DDR2 533MHZ) will it work in a motherboard that supports (DDR2 800/667)[/quote]It should.

Read full topic

item.title: Best Low Profile Card
item.dc:creator: @blah_bah7 blah bah7
item.description:
@blah_bah7 wrote:

ok so I was in the same situation as you, small dell (dells are shit, thats the last time i buy one of them), and had to play CoD4. The card i bought isn’t a “low profile” card, but it is a smaller card. I bought a Sapphire Radeon 4670, passive cooling. Easily runs CoD4 on high graphics, 125 fps

Read full topic

item.title: Best Low Profile Card
item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

[quote=“eczema3, post:16, topic:304621”][quote author=cows_be_sacred link=topic=400890.msg2974569#msg2974569 date=1254180383]

Ive decided to skip this. When I close the case up the thing gets up too about 110C. I’m going to try to scramble eggs tommorrow on the harddrive.

Just fucking buy a new case, that case is so small it probably can’t hold an actual graphics card unless it’s integrated, just transfer it over to this - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16811164121&cm_re=Case--11-164-121--Product

Good, much larger than yours, somewhat stylish, 'n cheap.
[/quote]
Stylish? It’s ugly as shit, I wouldn’t pay that much for a case like that.[/quote]
$23?
Anyways, if he wants a big cheap cooling case, they don’t get much better than that
http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16811144042&cm_re=Case--11-144-042--Product

Read full topic

item.title: Best Low Profile Card
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Oh I see, it’s a desktop, not a tower. I’d just get a $40 tower and put all your components in it. It will be worth it if you ever plan on upgrading more stuff (more drives etc) as well as for full length/double slot cards.

For the power switch, you should be able to unplug the current one from the motherboard, and plug in the one that comes with the new case.

Or just get what xEnt said…

Read full topic

item.title: Best Low Profile Card
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

4650 or 9500GT from that page.

Read full topic

item.title: Best Low Profile Card
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Unhandled:

Can you not move the hard drive down a slot?

Inside is exactaly the same as this wow I can’t believe dell made a shit poor design twice. But the exterior is very different. If you see where the harddrive is (it cant be moved) the card is right below it.

http://xps-dell.com/files/745sff_002.jpg

EDIT: and im not even joking about them being exactly the same (the sticker the heatsink the vent everything is the same) it is sad.

EDIT: im thinking about getting a larger btx case??? that way I can use full length video cards + get rid of this fuck noisy piece of shit powersupply that makes the whole thing sound like a jet engine BUT I was wondering…

About the on and off switch…will I need to do extra things to get this to work with a new case such as … hit me

Read full topic

item.description:
